results.title: Improving Support for Missing and Exploited Children Act of 2017
results.short_title: Improving Support for Missing and Exploited Children Act of 2017
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
results.summary: Improving Support for Missing and Exploited Children Act of 2017 This bill amends the Missing Children's Assistance Act:   to revise the definition of "missing child" to mean an individual under 18 years of age whose whereabouts are unknown to the individual's parent (currently, legal custodian);  to specify that a parent includes a legal guardian or an individual who functions as a parent (e.g., a grandparent);  to revise the functions and duties of the National Center on Missing and Exploited Children (NCMEC); and  to require the NCMEC to make publicly available the annual report on missing children and the incidence of attempted child abductions.
results.summary_short: Improving Support for Missing and Exploited Children Act of 2017 This bill amends the Missing Children's Assistance Act:   to revise the definition of "missing child" to mean an individual under 18 years of age whose whereabouts are unknown to the individual's parent (currently, legal custodian);  to specify that a parent includes a legal guardian or an individual who functions as a parent (e.g., a grandparent);  to revise the functions and duties of the National Center on Missing and Exploit...

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H4453-4454)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1808.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H4453-4457)
Mr. Guthrie moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 64.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Education and the Workforce. H. Rept. 115-110.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
